recipe_name: Fried goats' cheese with grape chutney
author: Nick Nairn
method: Pre-heat the oven to 220C/425F/Gas 7. Heat two tablespoons of oil in a pan and fry the tomatoes for a few minutes. Season and transfer to the oven for 8-10 minutes. Meanwhile, coat the goats' cheese in flour, dip in the egg and coat in the breadcrumbs. Repeat this process to give a second coating. Heat two tablespoons of oil in a non-stick frying pan and fry the breaded cheese for 2-3 minutes on each side, or until golden. To make the chutney, heat the grapes, vinegar, chilli flakes and sugar in a pan for 4-5 minutes, stirring occasionally. Transfer the roasted tomatoes to a serving plate and the fried cheese on top. Spoon the grape chutney alongside, to serve.
ingredients: 4 tbsp olive oil,  110g/4oz cherry tomatoes,  salt and freshly ground black pepper,  55g/2oz slice of goats' cheese,  30g/1oz plain flour,  1 egg, beaten,  30g/1oz brioche breadcrumbs,  85g/3oz grapes, cut in half,  1-2 tbsp white wine vinegar,  pinch of chilli flakes,  4 tbsp caster sugar
